widgets_values: If you have Triton installed, connect this for ~30% speed increase

Adjust the blocks to swap based on your VRAM, this is a tradeoff between speed and memory usage.

Alternatively there's option to use VRAM management introduced in DiffSynt-Studios. This is usually slower, but saves even more VRAM compared to BlockSwap
While the WanVideo 1.3B model is in FP32, the VACE module in it is in BF16, so using fp16_fast is technically lossy, but seems to be fine if you want the speed boost.

nodes.title: Model download link
widgets_values:
Original model link, you can rename to whatever you like:

[https://huggingface.co/ali-vilab/VACE-Wan2.1-1.3B-Preview/blob/main/diffusion_pytorch_model.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/ali-vilab/VACE-Wan2.1-1.3B-Preview/blob/main/diffusion_pytorch_model.safetensors)

fp8_fast seems to cause huge quality degradation

fp_16_fast enables "Full FP16 Accmumulation in FP16 GEMMs" feature available in the very latest pytorch nightly, this is around 20% speed boost. 

Sageattn if you have it installed can be used for almost double inference speed

Studio Ghibli Style, 30yo angry woman on the left and 40yo man in the center.
woman with light hair and yellow dress is opening a shower curtain.
man in a dark brown winter coat, brown fur hat, brown plaid scarf, is taking a shower standing at bathtub, behind shower curtain at bathroom,
bad quality, blurry, messy, chaotic, glasses
